content: Hello! The contribution I want to make is a single function to Vec (retain_indices), but the documentation makes it seem as though I'll need to go through the entire RFC process for that. Am I missing something?
Probably not, unless you change an unwritten assumption about how the function works. And you can't make it do something completely different.
is a single function, not is to a single function - it doesn't exist yet :stuck_out_tongue:
Ah, sorry, I didn't notice the _indices_ part :D. Hmm.

Changes to the standard library don't typically need an RFC if they're just an unstable method. Larger or more sweeping changes need an RFC, but individual methods don't. We'll review them via a normal PR, and then again when they come up for stabilization.
Also feel free to ping people in the rust-lang/libs team for guidance and reviews.
